stories.text:
Efficient and Effective Information Retrieval from Hacker News

To obtain the most relevant information on a submission/subject of interest,

I click on the site reference [1] first, this allows me to determine the sites user/HN ranking/reliability,

by the number of [dead]/[flagged] submissions vs. points [2] and comments [3],

and to see duplicate submissions with comments [3],

it also allows checking all submissions from a site of interest. [1]

I'm then able to click comments [3] and read HN Readers opinions/information.

How do You use HN to Inform and Educate yourself?

--

  Atlassian reveals critical flaws in almost everything it makes and touches (theregister.com) <-[1]

  26 points <-[2] by jerryjerryjerry 5 hours ago | flag | hide | past | 3 comments <-[3]
stories.title: Ask HN: Efficient and Effective Information Retrieval from Hacker News

stories.text:
humble-cli allows you to list all your Humble Bundle purchases, see their details, and download them from the comfort of your terminal.

It can also limit downloads based on their size and format.

stories.text:
A "recent news" article referencing the defunct "Sports Authority" caught my attention today. The entire text appears to be computer generated nonsense. Is there a business case for publishing this?

Article for reference: https://medium.com/@f3eulca622/15-reasons-why-you-shouldnt-ignore-baltimore-ravens-super-bowl-apparel-at-sports-authority-cheap-2b1a1166dc60
stories.title: Ask HN: What Is the Purpose of Publishing a Nonsense CG Article?
